meanings.definition: Unwilling to spend money or use resources; stingy.
meanings.sent1: She was so parsimonious that she refused to buy anything that wasn't absolutely necessary.
meanings.sent2: The parsimonious man always chose the cheapest option, even if it meant sacrificing quality.
meanings.sent3: The parsimonious squirrel hoarded acorns like they were made of gold.
meanings.sent4: Her parsimonious nature was like a locked treasure chest, never willing to share its riches.
meanings.sent5: The image of the parsimonious old man counting his pennies stuck in my mind.

meanings.definition: Excessively frugal or sparing in the use of resources.
meanings.sent1: The company's parsimonious approach to energy usage saved them a lot of money in the long run.
meanings.sent2: Her parsimonious habits extended to recycling and reusing items whenever possible.
meanings.sent3: The parsimonious chef managed to create a gourmet meal using only leftovers.
meanings.sent4: The garden's beauty was a result of the gardener's parsimonious watering schedule.
meanings.sent5: The parsimonious use of paint gave the room a minimalist yet elegant look.
